channel.title: Item.cfg Editor by Paradrop
channel.description:
Hello everyone!
I was tired of editing item.cfg with a template next to it to see what integer was which value, so I decided to make a item.cfg editor. Once I was done, I thought, hey maybe other people have the same "problem". So today I will share this tool with all of you.
It is [b]NOT[/b] written in Java though, it is written in C#. If people like this tool, I will make it in Java, so Linux or MacOS users can use this tool too.
[b]How it looks:[/b] [img]http://img402.imageshack.us/img402/7330/itemeditor.png[/img]
Because this tool is written in C#, there are 2 requirements to this tool: [b] 1. You need to run this tool on Windows 2. You need to have Microsoft .NET Framework 4 or higher installed - [url=http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=9cfb2d51-5ff4-4491-b0e5-b386f32c0992&displaylang=en]Download here![/url] [/b]
[b]THIS TOOL IS ONLY TESTED ON A DELTA SERVER[/b]
If you find any bugs, or if you like the tool, please post here!
(the tool is in the attachment btw. It's in a RAR, just run the setup)

item.title: Item.cfg Editor by Paradrop
item.dc:creator: @mursanari mursanari
item.description:
@mursanari wrote:

isnt this more of a generator then editor.

Edit:

Woops soz i just read it again.

Read full topic

item.title: Item.cfg Editor by Paradrop
item.dc:creator: @Paradrop Paradrop
item.description:
@Paradrop wrote:

I do use Notepad++ myself for other stuff. But what I hated about editing item.cfg was opening a text file with the template in it, the opening item.cfg in Notepad++, then counting in the template what number I had to edit, then counting in the Notepad++ screen which number I had to edit. And then when you log on to your server you see you edited the wrong number because you didnt count that well.

This makes it a lot easier (to me) to see what should go where very quickly.

I am going to make it in Java, and then make some extra features, like editing whether its a platebody or a shield or a helmet etc.
Once that is finished, you can’t disprove that it’s faster

Read full topic

item.title: Item.cfg Editor by Paradrop
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

I Vain I:

Because Notepad doesn’t work?

You’re right. That’s why Notepad++ was invented!

(Joking, it’s actually pretty damn easy to look at jumbled text & numbers)

Read full topic

item.title: Item.cfg Editor by Paradrop
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Notepad++ is a lot better than using Notepad, but I suppose people whom don’t know a thing about RuneScape Private Server’s when going into them wouldn’t know about Notepad++. This a interesting program for a beginner, so fair enough mate.

Read full topic

item.title: Item.cfg Editor by Paradrop
item.dc:creator: @Paradrop Paradrop
item.description:
@Paradrop wrote:

Okay, so you don’t like it. It speeded my editing up though, and, as I stated, it’s for the people who have the same “problem”:

Paradrop:

I was tired of editing item.cfg with a template next to it to see what integer was which value, so I decided to make a item.cfg editor. Once I was done, I thought, hey maybe other people have the same “problem”.

And I think that people who just started making their own server could use this because it is easier, because you can see which textbox represents which stat of the item.

Read full topic

item.title: Item.cfg Editor by Paradrop
item.dc:creator: @Paradrop Paradrop
item.description:
@Paradrop wrote:

I Vain I:

Because Notepad doesn’t work?

Because I was tired of Notepad, and this is faster if you need to do a lot of work in item.cfg, for example
change the prices of all items in a shop.

Read full topic
